### [HEALDSBURG MUSEUM](https://www.google.com/maps/place/221+Matheson+St,+Healdsburg,+CA+95448/@38.6112025,-122.8698441,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x80841731848c4301:0x5d831931eec700f8!8m2!3d38.6111983!4d-122.8672692!16s%2Fg%2F11bw4h9x4g?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDQwOS4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D)

### [221 MATHESON Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448](https://www.google.com/maps/place/221+Matheson+St,+Healdsburg,+CA+95448/@38.6112025,-122.8698441,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x80841731848c4301:0x5d831931eec700f8!8m2!3d38.6111983!4d-122.8672692!16s%2Fg%2F11bw4h9x4g?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDQwOS4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D)

### **Hours:  
Wednesday - Sunday, 11 am to 4 pm**

### **Free Admission**

### **CLOSED** : November 24 - 28 || [Our Favorite Toys exhibition](/events/2025/11/29/our-favorite-toys-1) opens November 29

### Museum Holidays:

Closed on the following holidays:  
New Year’s Day  
Martin Luther King Day  
President’s Day  
Easter Sunday  
Memorial Day  
Juneteenth  
4th of July  
Labor Day  
Thanksgiving Day  
Friday after Thanksgiving  
Christmas Eve  
Christmas Day

**Directions**  
Coming from the south on Highway 101, take exit 503 for Central Healdsburg. Continue on Healdsburg Avenue for approximately two blocks . Turn right on Matheson Street at the Plaza. Take Matheson Street for three blocks. The Healdsburg Museum is at the northwest corner of Fitch and Matheson Streets.

* * *

**Parking** : Free street parking is available on Fitch Street. Free and timed parking is avai...
admission_text:
__

##  Location 

St. John the Baptist School Parish Hall  
217 Fitch St  
Healdsburg, California 95448   
United States 

[ Get Directions __](http://maps.google.com/maps?saddr=&daddr=217+Fitch+St%2C+Healdsburg+California%2C+95448+US)

__

##  Date & Time 

Wednesday, 02/04/2026 - Wednesday, 03/11/2026 

Add to Calendar __ 02/04/2026 05:30:00 PM 03/11/2026 06:30:00 PM America/Los_Angeles Chris O'Sullivan Lecture Series California’s history is enjoying constant, dynamic reinvention, as fresh discoveries and innovative research reveal new perspectives on the past and challenge old presumptions. This course will explore the drama of California history from the profoundly consequential discovery of gold in 1848 to the early 20th century. Themes will include the distinctiveness of Gold Rush society and culture, the emergence of Barbary Coast San Francisco, and the consequences for California Native Americans. The course will also explore new perspectives on the development of the transcontinental railroad and the machinations of the Big Four railroad tycoons, the originality and vibrancy of California’s Gilded Age cultural life, the catastrophic earthquake and fire of 1906 and the remarkable recovery that followed, and the dramatic emergence of California as a distinctive regional culture in the late 19th and early 20th Centuries.  St. John the Baptist School Parish Hall 217 Fitch St Healdsburg, California 95448

__

##  Price 

$75 \- $225

# Healdsburg Museum

We collect, protect, preserve and interpret the artifacts, documents and photographs that trace the rich history of Healdsburg and surrounding area through exhibitions, educational programs and historical research. 

## [Healdsburg Museum Hours](/contact)
